text.p: These are the leading stories in the Belgrade press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified them and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Yugoslav Foreign Minister Milan Milutinovic will visit Austria on October 23 and 24.

- The assembly of the Serb-held region of Eastern Slavonia in Croatia reiterated its commitment on Monday to a declaration passed in June demanding that the region be granted special status within the republic.
- Yugoslav October average wages are 707 dinars, up 0.9 percent against previous month, said the federal statistics office.

- American Express travellers cheques will be available in four Yugoslav banks -- Komercijalna banka, Beobanka, Jugobanka and Karic banka -- as of Wednesday, said Vladimir Zimonjic, director of American Express for Yugoslavia.
- Head of provincial government of Vojvodina in Serbia, Bosko Perosevic, called on central bank to support major exporters.
- Number of visitors in Serbia in January-September period fell 11 pecent against the same period last year, the republic's statistics office said.
- U.S. special envoy John Kornblum to exert pressure on Bosnian Serb leadership and return them on "Dayton track". -- Belgrade Newsroom 381 11 222 4254
